original_solution_mapping.L2: So a total of 300*21=<<300*21=6300>>6300 people were arrested
original_solution_mapping.L3: They spend 14/2=<<14/2=7>>7 days of their sentence in jail
original_solution_mapping.L4: So they spend a total of 7+4=<<7+4=11>>11 days in jail
original_solution_mapping.L5: So there was a total of 6300*11=<<6300*11=69300>>69300 days in jail

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4505.
    Returns: the total combined weeks of jail time.
    """
    # L1
    protest_days = 30 # 30 days of protest
    arrests_per_day = 10 # 10 arrests per day
    arrests_per_city = protest_days * arrests_per_day

    # L2
    number_of_cities = 21 # 21 different cities
    total_people_arrested = arrests_per_city * number_of_cities

    # L3
    days_in_two_weeks = 14 # WK
    sentence_half_divisor = 2 # half of a 2-week sentence
    sentence_days_spent = days_in_two_weeks / sentence_half_divisor

    # L4
    days_before_trial = 4 # 4 days in jail before trial
    total_days_in_jail_per_person = sentence_days_spent + days_before_trial

    # L5
    total_jail_days = total_people_arrested * total_days_in_jail_per_person

    # L6
    days_per_week = 7 # WK
    total_jail_weeks = total_jail_days / days_per_week

    # FA
    answer = total_jail_weeks
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Each city arrest {protest_days}*{arrests_per_day}=<<{protest_days}*{arrests_per_day}={arrests_per_city}>>{arrests_per_city} people during the protest
So a total of {arrests_per_city}*{number_of_cities}=<<{arrests_per_city}*{number_of_cities}={total_people_arrested}>>{total_people_arrested} people were arrested
They spend {days_in_two_weeks}/{sentence_half_divisor}=<<{days_in_two_weeks}/{sentence_half_divisor}={sentence_days_spent}>>{sentence_days_spent} days of their sentence in jail
So they spend a total of {sentence_days_spent}+{days_before_trial}=<<{sentence_days_spent}+{days_before_trial}={total_days_in_jail_per_person}>>{total_days_in_jail_per_person} days in jail
So there was a total of {total_people_arrested}*{total_days_in_jail_per_person}=<<{total_people_arrested}*{total_days_in_jail_per_person}={total_jail_days}>>{total_jail_days} days in jail
So they spent {total_jail_days}/{days_per_week}=<<{total_jail_days}/{days_per_week}={total_jail_weeks}>>{total_jail_weeks} weeks in jail
